member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer
member.summary: Creates buffer polygons around input features to a specified distance.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input point, line, or polygon features to be buffered. (In, Required)
The feature class containing the output buffers. (Out, Required)

The distance around the input features that will be buffered. Distances can be provided as either a value representing a linear distance or as a field from the input features that contains the distance to buffer each feature. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.in_features
member.summary: The input point, line, or polygon features to be buffered. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.out_feature_class
member.summary: The feature class containing the output buffers. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.buffer_distance_or_field
member.summary: The distance around the input features that will be buffered. Distances can be provided as either a value representing a linear distance or as a field from the input features that contains the distance to buffer each feature. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.line_side
member.summary: The side(s) of the input features that will be buffered. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.line_end_type
member.summary: The shape of the buffer at the end of line input features. This parameter is not valid for polygon input features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.dissolve_option
member.summary: Specifies the dissolve to be performed to remove buffer overlap. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.dissolve_field
member.summary: The list of field(s) from the input features on which to dissolve the output buffers. Any buffers sharing attribute values in the listed fields (carried over from the input features) are dissolved. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Buffer.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

The features used to clip the input features. (In, Required)

member.summary: The feature class to be created. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Clip.cluster_tolerance
member.summary: The minimum distance separating all feature coordinates as well as the distance a coordinate can move in X or Y (or both). Set the value to be higher for data with less coordinate accuracy and lower for data with extremely high accuracy. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Erase
member.summary: Creates a feature class by overlaying the Input Features with the polygons of the Erase Features. Only those portions of the input features falling outside the erase features outside boundaries are copied to the output feature class.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Erase.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature class or layer. (In, Required)
The features to be used to erase coincident features in the input. (In, Required)
The feature class that will contain only those Input Features that are not coincident with the Erase Features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Erase.in_features
member.summary: The input feature class or layer. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Erase.erase_features
member.summary: The features to be used to erase coincident features in the input. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Erase.out_feature_class
member.summary: The feature class that will contain only those Input Features that are not coincident with the Erase Features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Erase.cluster_tolerance
member.summary: The minimum distance separating all feature coordinates (nodes and vertices) as well as the distance a coordinate can move in X or Y (or both). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Erase.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Erase.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Identity
member.summary: Computes a geometric intersection of the input features and identity features. The input features or portions thereof that overlap identity features will get the attributes of those identity features.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Identity.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature class or layer. (In, Required)
The identity feature class or layer. Must be polygons or the same geometry type as the input features. (In, Required)
The feature class that will be created and to which the results will be written. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Identity.in_features
member.summary: The input feature class or layer. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Identity.identity_features
member.summary: The identity feature class or layer. Must be polygons or the same geometry type as the input features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Identity.out_feature_class
member.summary: The feature class that will be created and to which the results will be written. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Identity.join_attributes
member.summary: Determines what attributes will be transferred to the output feature class. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Identity.cluster_tolerance
member.summary: The minimum distance separating all feature coordinates (nodes and vertices) as well as the distance a coordinate can move in X or Y (or both). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Identity.relationship
member.summary: Determines if additional spatial relationships between the in_features and the identity_features are to be written to the output. This only applies when the in_features are lines and the identity_features are polygons. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Identity.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Identity.ParameterInfo

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Intersect
member.summary: Computes a geometric intersection of the input features. Features or portions of features which overlap in all layers and/or feature classes will be written to the output feature class.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Intersect.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: A list of the input feature classes or layers. When the distance between features is less than the cluster tolerance, the features with the lower rank will snap to the feature with the higher rank. The highest rank is one. For more information, see Priority ranks and Geoprocessing tools. (In, Required)
The output feature class. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Intersect.in_features
member.summary: A list of the input feature classes or layers. When the distance between features is less than the cluster tolerance, the features with the lower rank will snap to the feature with the higher rank. The highest rank is one. For more information, see Priority ranks and Geoprocessing tools. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Intersect.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Intersect.join_attributes
member.summary: Determines which attributes from the Input Features will be transferred to the Output Feature Class. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Intersect.cluster_tolerance
member.summary: The minimum distance separating all feature coordinates (nodes and vertices) as well as the distance a coordinate can move in X or Y (or both). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Intersect.output_type
member.summary: Choose what type of intersection you want to find. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Intersect.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Intersect.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Intersect.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Intersect.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Intersect.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Update
member.summary: Computes a geometric intersection of the Input Features and Update Features. The attributes and geometry of the input features are updated by the update features in the output feature class.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature class or layer. Geometry type must be polygon. (In, Required)
The features that will be used to update the Input Features. Geometry type must be polygon. (In, Required)
The feature class to contain the results. Do not set this to be the same as the Input Features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Update.in_features
member.summary: The input feature class or layer. Geometry type must be polygon. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Update.update_features
member.summary: The features that will be used to update the Input Features. Geometry type must be polygon. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Update.out_feature_class
member.summary: The feature class to contain the results. Do not set this to be the same as the Input Features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Update.keep_borders
member.summary: Specifies whether the boundary of the update polygon features will be kept. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Update.cluster_tolerance
member.summary: The minimum distance separating all feature coordinates (nodes and vertices) as well as the distance a coordinate can move in X or Y (or both). (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Split
member.summary: Splitting the Input Features creates a subset of multiple output feature classes.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The features to be split. (In, Required)
The features containing a tabular field whose unique values are used to split the Input Features and provide the output feature classes' names. (In, Required)

The character field used to split the Input Features. This field's values identify the Split Features used to create each output feature class. The Split Field's unique values provide the output feature classes' names. (In, Required)
The workspace where the output feature classes are stored. (In, Required)

member.summary: The features to be split. (In, Required)

member.summary: The features containing a tabular field whose unique values are used to split the Input Features and provide the output feature classes' names. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Split.split_field
member.summary: The character field used to split the Input Features. This field's values identify the Split Features used to create each output feature class. The Split Field's unique values provide the output feature classes' names. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Split.out_workspace
member.summary: The workspace where the output feature classes are stored. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Split.cluster_tolerance
member.summary: The minimum distance separating all feature coordinates (nodes and vertices) as well as the distance a coordinate can move in X or Y (or both). Set the value to be higher for data that has less coordinate accuracy and lower for datasets with extremely high accuracy. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Workspace (out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near
member.summary: Determines the distance from each feature in the input features to the nearest feature in the near features, within the search radius.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input features that can be point, polyline, polygon, or multipoint type. (In, Required)

Value used to find the nearest features from input features. There can be one or more entries of near features; each entry can be of point, polyline, polygon, or multipoint type. When multiple entries of near features are specified, a new field, NEAR_FC, is added to the input table to store the paths of the source feature class that contains the nearest features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near.in_features
member.summary: The input features that can be point, polyline, polygon, or multipoint type. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near.near_features
member.summary: Value used to find the nearest features from input features. There can be one or more entries of near features; each entry can be of point, polyline, polygon, or multipoint type. When multiple entries of near features are specified, a new field, NEAR_FC, is added to the input table to store the paths of the source feature class that contains the nearest features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near.search_radius
member.summary: Specifies the radius used to search for candidate near features. The near features within this radius are considered for calculating the nearest feature. If no value is specified, that is, the default (empty) radius is used, all near features are considered for calculation. The unit of the search radius defaults to the units of the coordinate system of the input features. The units can be changed to any other unit. However, this has no impact on the units of NEAR_DIST which is based on the units of the coordinate system of the input features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near.location
member.summary: Specifies whether x- and y-coordinates of the nearest location of the near feature will be written to new fields NEAR_X and NEAR_Y, respectively. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near.angle
member.summary: Specifies whether the near angle values in decimal degrees will be calculated and written to a new field, NEAR_ANGLE. A near angle measures from the x-axis (horizontal axis) to the direction of the line connecting an input feature to its nearest feature at their closest locations, and it is within the range of 0 to 180 or 0 to -180 decimal degrees - 0 to the east, 90 to the north, 180 (-180Â°) to the west, and -90 to the south. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near.out_feature_class
member.summary: Output Feature Class (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Near.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PointDistance
member.summary: Determines the distances from input point features to all points in the near features within a specified search radius.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PointDistance.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The point features from which distances to the near features will be calculated. (In, Required)

The points to which distances from the input features will be calculated. Distances between points within the same feature class or layer can be determined by specifying the same feature class or layer for the input and near features. (In, Required)

The table containing the list of input features and information about all near features within the search radius. If a search radius is not specified, distances from all input features to all near features are calculated. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PointDistance.in_features
member.summary: The point features from which distances to the near features will be calculated. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PointDistance.near_features
member.summary: The points to which distances from the input features will be calculated. Distances between points within the same feature class or layer can be determined by specifying the same feature class or layer for the input and near features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PointDistance.out_table
member.summary: The table containing the list of input features and information about all near features within the search radius. If a search radius is not specified, distances from all input features to all near features are calculated. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PointDistance.search_radius
member.summary: Specifies the radius used to search for candidate near features. The near features within this radius are considered for calculating the nearest feature. If no value is specified (that is, the default (empty) radius is used) all near features are considered for calculation. The unit of search radius defaults to units of the input features. The units can be changed to any other unit. However, this has no impact on the units of the output DISTANCE field which is based on the units of the coordinate system of the input features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PointDistance.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PointDistance.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PointDistance.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PointDistance.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PointDistance.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Select
member.summary: Extracts features from an input feature class or input feature layer, typically using a select or Structured Query Language (SQL) expression and stores them in an output feature class.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Select.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature class or layer from which features are selected. (In, Required)
The output feature class to be created. If no expression is used, it contains all input features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Select.in_features
member.summary: The input feature class or layer from which features are selected. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Select.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class to be created. If no expression is used, it contains all input features. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Select.where_clause
member.summary: An SQL expression used to select a subset of features. The syntax for the expression differs slightly depending on the data source. For example, if you're querying file or ArcSDE geodatabases, shapefiles, or coverages, enclose field names in double quotes: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Select.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Select.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Select.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Select.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.TableSelect
member.summary: Selects table records matching a Structured Query Language (SQL) expression and writes them to an output table.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.TableSelect.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The table whose records matching the specified expression will be written to the output table. (In, Required)
The output table containing records from the input table that match the specified expression. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.TableSelect.in_table
member.summary: The table whose records matching the specified expression will be written to the output table. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.TableSelect.out_table
member.summary: The output table containing records from the input table that match the specified expression. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.TableSelect.where_clause
member.summary: An SQL expression used to select a subset of records. The syntax for the expression differs slightly depending on the data source. For example, if you're querying file or ArcSDE geodatabases, shapefiles, coverages, or dBASE or INFO tables, enclose field names in double quotes: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.TableSelect.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.TableSelect.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.TableSelect.ParameterInfo

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Frequency
member.summary: Reads a table and a set of fields and creates a new table containing unique field values and the number of occurrences of each unique field value.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Frequency.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The table containing the field(s) that will be used to calculate frequency statistics. This table can be an INFO or OLE DB table, a dBASE or a VPF table, or a feature class table. (In, Required)
The table that will store the calculated frequency statistics. (Out, Required)
The attribute field or fields that will be used to calculate frequency statistics. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Frequency.in_table

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Statistics

The output dBASE or geodatabase table that will store the calculated statistics. (Out, Required)

The numeric field containing attribute values used to calculate the specified statistic. Multiple statistic and field combinations may be specified. Null values are excluded from all statistical calculations. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Statistics.in_table
member.summary: The input table containing the field(s) that will be used to calculate statistics. The input can be an INFO table, a dBASE table, an OLE DB table, a VPF table, or a feature class. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Statistics.case_field

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin
member.summary: Joins attributes from one feature to another based on the spatial relationship. The target features and the joined attributes from the join features are written to the output feature class.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: Attributes of the target features and the attributes from the joined features are transferred to the output feature class. However, a subset of attributes can be defined in the field map parameter. The target features can be any spatial data source supported by ArcGIS. (In, Required)

The attributes from the join features are joined to the attributes of the target features. See the explanation of the Join Operation parameter for details on how the aggregation of joined attributes are affected by the type of join operation. (In, Required)

A new feature class containing the attributes of the target and join features. By default, all attributes of target features and the attributes of the joined features are written to the output. However, the set of attributes to be transferred can be controlled by the field map parameter. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.target_features
member.summary: Attributes of the target features and the attributes from the joined features are transferred to the output feature class. However, a subset of attributes can be defined in the field map parameter. The target features can be any spatial data source supported by ArcGIS. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.join_features
member.summary: The attributes from the join features are joined to the attributes of the target features. See the explanation of the Join Operation parameter for details on how the aggregation of joined attributes are affected by the type of join operation. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.out_feature_class
member.summary: A new feature class containing the attributes of the target and join features. By default, all attributes of target features and the attributes of the joined features are written to the output. However, the set of attributes to be transferred can be controlled by the field map parameter. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.join_operation
member.summary: Determines how joins between the target features and join features will be handled in the output feature class if multiple join features are found that have the same spatial relationship with a single target feature. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.join_type
member.summary: Determines if all target features will be maintained in the output feature class (known as outer join), or only those that have the specified spatial relationship with the join features (inner join). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.field_mapping
member.summary: Controls what attribute fields will be in the output feature class. The initial list contains all the fields from both the target features and the join features. Fields can be added, deleted, renamed, or have their properties changed. The selected fields from the target features are transferred as is, but selected fields from the join features can be aggregated by a merge rule. For details on field mapping, see Using the field mapping control and Mapping input fields to output fields. Multiple fields and statistic combination may be specified. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.match_option
member.summary: Defines the criteria used to match rows. The match options are: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.search_radius
member.summary: Join features within this distance of a target feature will be considered for the spatial join. A search radius is only valid when the spatial relationship (Match Option) INTERSECT or CLOSEST is specified. Using a search radius of 100 meters with the spatial relationship INTERSECT is the equivalent of saying: if a join feature is within 100 meters of a target feature, consider the join feature to be a match. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.distance_field_name
member.summary: The name of a field to be added to the output feature class, which contains the distance between the target feature and the closest join feature. This option is only valid when the spatial relationship (Match Option) CLOSEST is specified. The value of this field is -1 if no feature is matched within a search radius. If no field name is specified, the field will not be added to the output feature class. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.SpatialJoin.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable
member.summary: Determines the distances from each feature in the input features to one or more nearby features in the near features, within the search radius. The results are recorded in the output table.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input features that can be point, polyline, polygon, or multipoint type. (In, Required)

Value used to find the nearest features from input features. There can be one or more entries of near features; each entry can be of point, polyline, polygon, or multipoint type. When multiple entries of near features are specified, a new field, NEAR_FC, is added to the input table to store the paths of the source feature class that contains the nearest features. (In, Required)

The output table that will contain the proximity informationâsuch as IN_FID, NEAR_FID, and NEAR_DISTâand other attributesâsuch as location (NEAR_X, NEAR_Y) and angle (NEAR_ANGLE)âof the near feature and the NEAR_FC, if necessary. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.in_features
member.summary: The input features that can be point, polyline, polygon, or multipoint type. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.near_features
member.summary: Value used to find the nearest features from input features. There can be one or more entries of near features; each entry can be of point, polyline, polygon, or multipoint type. When multiple entries of near features are specified, a new field, NEAR_FC, is added to the input table to store the paths of the source feature class that contains the nearest features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.out_table
member.summary: The output table that will contain the proximity informationâsuch as IN_FID, NEAR_FID, and NEAR_DISTâand other attributesâsuch as location (NEAR_X, NEAR_Y) and angle (NEAR_ANGLE)âof the near feature and the NEAR_FC, if necessary. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.search_radius
member.summary: Specifies the radius used to search for candidate near features. The near features within this radius are considered for calculating the nearest feature. If no value is specified, that is, the default (empty) radius is used, all near features are considered for calculation. The unit of the search radius defaults to the units of the coordinate system of the input features. The units can be changed to any other unit. However, this has no impact on the units of NEAR_DIST which is based on the units of the coordinate system of the input features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.location
member.summary: Specifies whether x- and y-coordinates of the nearest location of the near feature will be written to new fields NEAR_X and NEAR_Y, respectively. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.angle
member.summary: Specifies whether the near angle values in decimal degrees will be calculated and written to a new field, NEAR_ANGLE. A near angle measures from the x-axis (horizontal axis) to the direction of the line connecting an input feature to its nearest feature at their closest locations, and it is within the range of 0 to 180 or 0 to -180 decimal degrees - 0 to the east, 90 to the north, 180 (-180Â°) to the west, and -90 to the south. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.closest
member.summary: Determines whether to locate and return only the closest features or all the features within the search radius. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.closest_count
member.summary: Find only the specified number of closest features. This parameter will not be used if the Find only closest feature option is checked. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.GenerateNearTable.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Union
member.summary: Computes a geometric union of the input features. All features and their attributes will be written to the output feature class.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Union.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: A list of the input feature classes or layers. When the distance between features is less than the cluster tolerance, the features with the lower rank will snap to the feature with the higher rank. The highest rank is one. All of the input features must be polygons. (In, Required)
The feature class that will contain the results. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Union.in_features
member.summary: A list of the input feature classes or layers. When the distance between features is less than the cluster tolerance, the features with the lower rank will snap to the feature with the higher rank. The highest rank is one. All of the input features must be polygons. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Union.out_feature_class
member.summary: The feature class that will contain the results. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Union.join_attributes
member.summary: Determines which attributes from the input features will be transferred to the output feature class. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Union.cluster_tolerance
member.summary: The minimum distance separating all feature coordinates (nodes and vertices) as well as the distance a coordinate can move in X or Y (or both). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Union.gaps
member.summary: Gaps are areas in the output feature class that are completely enclosed by other polygons. This is not invalid, but it may be desirable to identify these for analysis. To find the gaps in the output, set this option to NO_GAPS, and a feature will be created in these areas. To select these features, query the output feature class based on all the input feature's FID values being equal to -1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Union.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Union.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Union.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Union.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.Union.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.summary: The attribute field or fields that will be used to define zones. (In, Required)

param.name: in_class_features
param.summary: The features used to identify classes. (In, Required)

param.name: out_table
param.summary: The table that will contain the cross-tabulation of intersections between zones and classes. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The table that will contain the cross-tabulation of intersections between zones and classes. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.TabulateIntersection.class_fields

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.TabulateIntersection.xy_tolerance

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.TabulateIntersection.out_units
member.summary: Units to be used to calculate area or length measurements. Setting Output Units when the Input Class Features are points is not supported. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PolygonNeighbors
member.summary: Creates a table with statistics based on polygon contiguity (overlaps, coincident edges, or nodes).

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PolygonNeighbors.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PolygonNeighbors.in_features
member.summary: The input polygon features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PolygonNeighbors.out_table
member.summary: The output table. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PolygonNeighbors.in_fields
member.summary: Input attribute field or fields used to identify unique polygons or polygon groups and represent them in the output. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PolygonNeighbors.area_overlap
member.summary:
Determines if overlapping polygons will be analyzed and reported in the output.
(In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PolygonNeighbors.both_sides
member.summary: Determines if both sides of neighbor relationships will be included in the output. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PolygonNeighbors.cluster_tolerance
member.summary: The minimum distance between coordinates before they are considered equal. By default, this is the XY Tolerance of the input features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PolygonNeighbors.out_linear_units
member.summary: Units used to report the total length of the coincident edge between neighboring polygons. The default is the input feature units. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.AnalysisTools.PolygonNeighbors.out_area_units
member.summary: Units used to report the area overlap of neighboring polygons. The default is the input feature units. This parameter is only enabled when the area_overlap parameter is set to AREA_OVERLAP. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.
